title: Original Chex Party Mix Recipe
description: This 1970s-style Chex party mix recipe combines buttery, seasoned nuts, pretzels, bagel chips, and cereal to create a classic savory snack.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Trusted Brands: Recipes and Tips Chex® Party Mix Original Chex Party Mix 4.3 (406) 311 Reviews 28 Photos This 1970s-style Chex party mix recipe still tastes great after all these years!  Submitted by Chex Updated on April 3, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 28 28 28 28 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 24 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 24 servings 3 cups Corn Chex® cereal 3 cups Rice Chex® cereal 3 cups Wheat Chex® cereal 1 cup mixed nuts 1 cup bite-size pretzels 1 cup garlic-flavor bite-size bagel chips or regular-size bagel chips, broken into 1-inch pieces 6 tablespoons butter 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce 1 ½ teaspoons seasoned salt ¾ teaspoon garlic powder ½ teaspoon onion powder Directions Combine cereals, nuts, pretzels, and bagel chips in a large microwave-safe bowl; set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Microwave butter in a small microwave-safe bowl, uncovered, on High until melted; stir in Worcestershire sauce, seasoned salt, garlic powder, and onion powder. Pour over cereal mixture; stir until evenly coated. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Microwave, uncovered, on High for 5 to 6 minutes, thoroughly stirring every 2 minutes. Spread on paper towels to cool. Store in an airtight container. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 690 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 146 Calories 7g Fat 19g Carbs 3g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 24 Calories 146 % Daily Value * Total Fat 7g 9% Saturated Fat 3g 13% Cholesterol 8mg 3% Sodium 365mg 16% Total Carbohydrate 19g 7% Dietary Fiber 2g 6% Total Sugars 2g Protein 3g 6% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 9mg 1% Iron 1mg 4% Potassium 84mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Original Chex Party Mix 01 of 28 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 28 Photo by  Paula 09/23/2022 I use this basic recipe, but I'm hesitant to say I use Crispix cereal and add Cheerios. I just make sure it works out to 9 cups of cereals. What I like is the seasoning. I also follow the original directions and cook it in a 250 degree oven for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes. ***9/23/2022 I couldn't find wheat chex or bran chex in the summertime, so I used a combination of rice chex, corn chex, pretzels, and cheerios to equal 9 cups. I also used 1/2 cup butter plus all the seasonings. 03 of 28 Photo by  jim hall 02/07/2021 did not have the perfect ingredient mix but isn't that is why it is fun - only one type of Chex but I added Kix as a substitute - pretty simple to make and the key is to continue to experiment with the seasoning/spice mix to get the Mix just how you like it - a good recipe 04 of 28 Photo by  Wendy E Donaldson 01/23/2021 05 of 28 Photo by  Marianna Southard Debolt 12/20/2020 My husbands favorite every Christmas and on vacation. I leave the onion powder out. I agree, we have always done 250, stirring every 15 minutes. Have learned over the the years, 3 boxes make way more than we need. I do half the boxes and feed the birdies with the rest. 06 of 28 Photo by  Summer Bowman 04/01/2020 07 of 28 Photo by  jenshep 01/31/2020 Three stars the original way. Very good when edited! Double the dry spice ingredients. It’s super bland if you don’t double. I’ve subbed different things- pretzels, goldfish, garlic pita chips. Just go with your liking but be cognizant of the dry to wet ingredients. A couple of splashes of Tabasco is good too. I follow the measurements for the original recipe when I sub. I’ve not tried microwaving it. I’ve always had a 250 oven. Bake 1 hour and stir every 15 minutes. Store in a ziplock after cooling. 08 of 28 Photo by  Amy Smith 12/15/2019 I go ahead and use an whole stick of butter and a tad bit more seasoning (I like mine salty) I also add gold fish crackers! I prefer the baking method over the microwave but that’s just me. Awesomely addictive. 09 of 28 Photo by  lgoogins 12/23/2018 10 of 28 Photo by  Carlyn Mellon 01/10/2018 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Peach Cobbler Chex Party Mix 1 Rating Spiced Nuts Chex Party Mix Chex Lemon Buddies 96 Ratings Banana Nut Bread Chex Party Mix 1 Rating Chocolate Chex Caramel Crunch 87 Ratings Cheesy Ranch Chex Mix 86 Ratings Chex Muddy Buddies 201 Ratings Hidden Valley Bacon & Cheddar Dip 11 Ratings Original Ranch Spinach Dip 27 Ratings Soft and Chewy Chocolate-Banana Oat Bars 10 Ratings Caramel-Churro Chex Mix Homemade Chex Party Mix 16 Ratings Buttery Gluten-Free Ranch Chex Mix 3 Ratings Soccer Chex Mix 26 Ratings Brownie Buddy Snack Mix 1 Rating Churro Chex Mix 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
